caption.p: Status at Each Step in the Human Immunodeficiency Virus Care Continuum in the United States, 2019

tr.td: 14% of HIV-infected individuals are not aware of their serostatus ( 34)
85% of PLWH are now linked to care within 3 months of diagnosis ( 34), up from 59%–80% several years ago ( 35, 36)
40%–57% of diagnosed PLWH are retained in care ( 34, 36)
86% of PLWH in care report being adherent, but estimates including undiagnosed PLWH and those not engaged in care are closer to be 24–37% ( 78)

85%–90% of treated PLWH now achieve viral suppression. However only approximately 60% of diagnosed PLWH at virally suppressed ( 6, 34), suggesting that its approximately 51% when including undiagnosed PLWH ( 79)

table-wrap-foot.p: Abbreviations: ART, antiretroviral therapy; HIV, human immunodeficiency virus; PLWH, people living with human immunodeficiency virus.
